title: How to write a C++ program that allows to enter and display 5 names - Quora

response.answer_text: This will require you to enter 5 names, and once you do, it will display 5 names. #include <iostream> #include <string>  int main() {     std::string s;      while (true) {         std::cout << "Enter 5 names: ";         std::getline(std::cin, s);         if (s == "5 names") {             break;         }         std::cout << "That is not 5 names.  Please try again.\n";     }      std::cout << "Congratulations!  Now displaying: " << s << '\n';     return 0; } That’s how I write such a C++ program.* I suggest the way you write such a C++ program should look a bit different than that.  * Technically, that’s the result of me writing the C++ program. For the actual how, I used vim inside an xterm window, and a keyboard to type it in. I then copied and pasted it here after testing it. You do test your code, right?  P.S. If you think this answer is overly literal, just wait until you’ve dealt with the computer one-on-one. It has no sense of humor, and takes your input extremely literally.
